_metadata.course_description: Personal computing is now mobile and cloud-based. Disconnected mobile computing challenges many of the assumptions underlying much of today's distributed systems.
learning_outcomes: Implement and run applications on a mobile computing platform.
Explain algorithms and strategies for data management and power management.
Describe wireless communication protocols, including cell phone and LAN protocols, and network protocols for mobile applications.
Describe threats and countermeasures for securing mobile devices.
Explain the use of context scenarios and personas in user experience (UX) engineering for mobile applications.
Apply design patterns and software architectures to manage the complexity of mobile applications, including cloud-based apps.
prerequisites: Programming Maturity and Experience with Java or C#
